page.title: 12WATER OF LEITH,EDINBURGH..
page.content: The{Water of Leith}is a small river that runs through Edinburgh,passing many of its{villages}as it goes.From {Stockbridge}it flows under the{Dean {Bridge,}designed by{Thomas Telford}in 1832, to the scenic{Dean Village,}dean meaning a gorge or deep village and here it is possibly at its most beautiful. Then it flows on to {Roseburn.}Its banks are put to use in many ways. There is plenty of{wildlife to study and watch whilst many {fishermen}can be seen casting at its side. Along its{footpaths}people stroll with their pets enjoying the peaceful surrounds. If you walk upstream you can visit the{Dean {Cemetery}where many famous people are buried.
